result.execSummary:
The defendant Roxanna Therese Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the defendant is to receive sentence credit of 2 days and sentence may be served with huber.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roxanna Therese Ramirez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
9:40 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Peebles, a resolution has been reached.  Atty Peebles recites plea agreement - 14CF72: charge will be be amended to a misdemeanor; 14CF27 - count 1 will be dismissed, defendant will plea to count 2 with a fine and costs.  2014TR864 will be dismissed.  DA concurs.  Statement by DA.  Atty Peebles concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court dismisses 2014TR864 and adds the Ignition Interlock Device for a period of 12 months to 2014TR658.  

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to the amended count 1 on 2014CF72 and count 2 on 2014CF127.  Court orders count 1 on 2014CF127 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Peebles.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2014CF127

Court sentences the defendant to a $250 fine plus costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.


2014CF72

30 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 12 months probation.  Court grants huber.

CONDITIONS:
-court costs
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court grants the defendant 2 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 9:56 a.m.

3:33 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney James Peebles.  

Statement by Attorney Peebles - requests preliminary hearing be scheduled on 2014CF127.  Court so directs and to be held after the first of the year.  Court directs 2014CF72 to track with that case.

Court adjourned at 3:35 p.m.
Status hearing on December 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

2:20 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney James Peebles.

Attorney Peebles confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading - enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court goes over the maximum penalties and as a repeater.  

Court directs Status Hearing to be held in approximately sixty days.

Court adjourned at 2:22 p.m.

3:08 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney James Peebles.

Defendant confirms her waiver of the preliminary hearing.  Court instructs defendant of her right to a preliminary hearing - defendant waives this right - Court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

Court directs Arraignment be held within thirty days.

Court adjourned at 3:10 p.m.
Status of Prelim on September 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

9:54 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the receipt of a letter from Atty James Peebles.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Court notes that bond has been set.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing when Atty Peebles will be here.

2014TR864 - Atty James Peebles enters a plea of Not Guilty in writing.  Matter to track with the felony case.

Court adjourned at 9:56 a.m.
from Atty James Peebles - represents the defendant on this matter and is unable to make the court date due to a scheduling conflict.  (VIA FAX ONLY)
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

1:05 p.m.  Defendant present in court, in custody via video from the Green Lake County Jail with Atty Reisha Mitchell.  Kyle Sargent for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court orders bond set at $500.00 signature bond and condition of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Court adjourned at 1:07 p.m.
